title: Biology Vocabulary Quiz
description: Discover the language of life sciences, from cells and organisms to ecosystems and evolution.

questions.question: What is 'photosynthesis'?
options: The breakdown of food in the stomach
The process by which plants convert sunlight into chemical energy
The movement of water through soil

questions.question: What does 'mitosis' refer to?
options: A type of cell division that results in two identical daughter cells

questions.question: What is a 'chromosome'?
options: A part of the cell membrane
A thread-like structure of DNA that carries genetic information

questions.question: What does 'osmosis' describe?
options: The evaporation of water from leaves
The movement of water through a semipermeable membrane from low to high solute concentration

questions.question: What is 'taxonomy'?
options: The science of classifying and naming organisms

questions.question: What does 'symbiosis' mean?
options: A close and often long-term interaction between different species

questions.question: What is 'metabolism'?
options: The sum of all chemical reactions in a living organism
The movement of blood through veins

questions.question: What is an 'enzyme'?
options: A biological catalyst that speeds up chemical reactions in the body

questions.question: What does 'adaptation' mean in biology?
options: A trait that helps an organism survive and reproduce in its environment

questions.question: What is 'cytoplasm'?
options: The wall of a plant cell
The jelly-like substance inside a cell that surrounds the nucleus
The outer shell of a cell

questions.question: What is a 'genome'?
options: The complete set of genetic material in an organism

questions.question: What does 'biodiversity' refer to?
options: The variety of life forms in an ecosystem or on Earth
The number of plants in a garden
The height of a forest canopy

questions.question: What is 'homeostasis'?
options: The maintenance of a stable internal environment in an organism

questions.question: What does 'mutation' mean in biology?
options: A change in the DNA sequence of an organism

questions.question: What is 'cellular respiration'?
options: The process by which cells break down glucose to produce energy
The movement of air in the lungs
The absorption of oxygen through the skin
